objects.name: coldsteel
objects.description: COLDSTEEL is a fully featured Windows Remote Access Tool (RAT) delivered as a DLL (often newdev.dll) that provides interactive desktop control and command-line invocation. It supports copying/moving/deleting files, uploading/downloading files to/from the C2, taking screenshots and capturing cursor position, simulating keyboard and mouse input (including Ctrl+Alt+Del), enumerating sessions and drives, and establishing a reverse TCP shell using cmd.exe (sometimes masqueraded as dllhost.exe). It persists by creating a Windows service (e.g., msupdate/msupdate2 or service loaded via svchost.exe) and modifies related registry keys. COLDSTEEL communicates with its C2 over raw TCP sockets (commonly ports 443, 8843, or 8888) using a custom header and message format; in non-2017 variants, it obfuscates content bytes with a simple XOR/add routine using a key derived from 0x1D. Initial beacons include system information, usernames, memory, uptime, and variant ID strings such as MileStone2016, MileStone2017, or FBI20111024. Some variants are packed with the Themida packer (e.g., versions 3.0.5 and 3.1.1) to frustrate analysis. Additional capabilities include creating a temporary administrator account (ANONYMOUS or _DomainUser_) to launch a new instance and then removing the account, uninstalling itself in older variants, deleting files, and process interaction in the FBI20111024 variant. The malware often imitates legitimate-sounding Windows service names to hide in plain sight.

objects.name: Ahnlab
objects.description: Cited industry source that previously reported on COLDSTEEL.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Cited industry source that previously reported on COLDSTEEL.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell
objects.description: COLDSTEEL can run arbitrary commands using cmd.exe.

objects.name: System Services: Service Execution
objects.description: COLDSTEEL executes malicious code as a Windows service.

objects.name: Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service
objects.description: COLDSTEEL creates an autostart service to persist after a system reboot.

objects.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
objects.description: COLDSTEEL is believed to have been deployed following exploitation of Log4j.

objects.name: Obfuscated/Compressed Files and Information: Software Packing
objects.description: MileStone2017 variants of COLDSTEEL have been observed to be packed using Themida as described in Defence Evasion (Themida).

objects.name: Modify Registry
objects.description: COLDSTEEL modifies registry keys directly to add a description to its service.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: COLDSTEEL has the ability to delete files from the infected machine.

objects.name: Access Token Manipulation: Create Process with Token
objects.description: The MileStone2016 variant of COLDSTEEL has the ability to create a process as the user named ANONYMOUS.

objects.name: System Information Discovery
objects.description: COLDSTEEL collects a range of system information from the infected machine.

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: COLDSTEEL has commands to enumerate the filesystem.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: FBI20111024 variants of COLDSTEEL have the ability to collect process information.

objects.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
objects.description: COLDSTEEL communicates over TCP sockets, using a custom message format.

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_service_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule COLDSTEEL_service_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the service created by COLDSTEEL."
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "a94ed3d673261d62f2959979272d8c8d17e6e7f3"

    strings:
        $ = "msupdate"
        $ = "Microsoft Update"
        $ = "Enables the download and installation of Windows updates. If
this service is disabled, this computer will not be able to use the
Automatic Updates feature or the Windows Update Web site."

    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_rundll32_use_and_export_names
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule COLDSTEEL_rundll32_use_and_export_names
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Execution method used by COLDSTEEL."
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "a94ed3d673261d62f2959979272d8c8d17e6e7f3"

    strings:
         $ = "rundll32.exe \"%s\",UpdateDriverForPlugAndPlayDevicesW"

    condition:
        all of them
        and pe.exports("UpdateDriverForPlugAndPlayDevicesW")
        and pe.exports("ServiceMain")
        and pe.exports("DiUninstallDevice")
}

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule COLDSTEEL_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "COLDSTEEL strings"
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "a94ed3d673261d62f2959979272d8c8d17e6e7f3"

    strings:
        $ = "MileStone201"
        $ = "%SystemRoot%\\System32\\svchost.exe -k "
        $ = "%s SP%d"
        $ = "Win 2003"
        $ = "Win 98"
        $ = "RegSetValueEx(Svchost\\krnlsrvc)"
        $ = "RegOpenKeyEx(Svchost)"
        $ = "RegSetValueEx(ServiceDll)"

    condition:
        7 of them
}

objects.name: COLDSTEEL_Themida_useage
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule COLDSTEEL_Themida_useage
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "COLDSTEEL Themida import usage."
        date = "2023-01-31"
        hash1 = "9ec69a042106fc9d27a27197d3b680b468bca9a0"

    strings:
        $ = ".themida"
    condition:
        all of them
        and pe.exports("ServiceMain")

  and pe.imports("CloseServiceHandle", "ADVAPI32")
  and pe.imports("CreateEnvironmentBlock", "USERENV")
  and pe.imports("CreateWindowExA", "USER32")
  and pe.imports("SHGetFileInfoA", "SHELL32")
  and pe.imports("SelectObject", "GDI32")
  and pe.imports("WTSQuerySessionInformationA", "WTSAPI32")
  and pe.imports("strcspn", "MSVCRT")

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Coldsteel
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. coldsteel.
